verses.roman:
yaiche kahi,--ei vipra parama paṇḍita
vipra--anuvāda, ihāra vidheya--pāṇḍitya

synonyms: yaiche—just as; kahi—I say; ei—this; vipra—brāhmaṇa; parama—great; paṇḍita—learned man; vipra—the brāhmaṇa; anuvāda—subject; ihāra—of this; vidheya—predicate; pāṇḍitya—erudition.
translation: "For example, we may say: 'This vipra is a greatly learned man.' In this sentence, the vipra is the subject, and the predicate is his erudition.
